result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeremiah J. Bergeron was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeremiah J. Bergeron was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jeremiah J. Bergeron

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation and Parole when released, if Probation has not come to see him in the jail.  If revoked the defendant has 46 days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 2 and Ct 3 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.
Per State Statute 343.301(2m), Ignition Interlock Device requirement begins on the date the Dept. of Transportation issues any license under Chapt. 343.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied, remaining balance will be paid directly to the court on a payment plan of $25.00 a month starting 08/03/2022, to include  22TR08.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.
Defendant is to obtain/maintain employment of at least 25 hours a week or as directed by his agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence of 29 days to start immediately.  All of the jail sentence is stayed except for 29 days, pending successfully completion of AODA Assessment.  Jail sentence is on Ct 2 only.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

timeConds.notes: Defendant to find own Community Service with the approval of the Agent.   Community Service is on Ct 3 only.

02:02 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Jeremiah J. Bergeron, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.    Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.    The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered his plea, knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant Guilty.  22TR8 defnedant plead No contest, all other TR's and the FO is dismissed and read in.
